question: Which cancer has the kynureninase pathway been associated to?
ideal_answer: The kynurenine pathway has been associated with human glioma pathophysiology.

snippets.text: Involvement of the kynurenine pathway in human glioma pathophysiology.

These results provide further evidence for the involvement of the KP in glioma pathophysiology and highlight a potential role of KP products as novel and highly attractive therapeutic targets to evaluate for the treatment of brain tumors, aimed at restoring anti-tumor immunity and reducing the capacity for malignant cells to produce NAD(+), which is necessary for energy production and DNA repair.
